event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Driver May Be Defective
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris Fault Manager has determined that a software defect was detected in Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 driver which requires repair action.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The driver has been disabled and unregistered as a hardware provider to the Solaris Cryptographic Framework.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The card will no longer function as a network device or cryptographic accelerator until the problem has been resolved.
event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Run pkgchk -n SUNWvcar to ensure that the latest software is correctly installed on the system for the module (rsrc) identified in the fmdump(1M) output as instructed in the Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Board Installation and Users Guide.

If the latest driver has already been installed, contact Sun for support.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Message ID:  %MSGID% indicates diagnosis has determined that the SCA4000 (vca) driver is defective. The SCA4000 (vca) driver has disabled the network and cryptographic accelerator interfaces. Insure that the latest driver package (SUNWvcar) is installed on the system.

After installing the latest software,  the network and cryptographic accelerator interfaces may be brought back into service using the fmadm(1M) command:

fmadm repair <event_id>
